alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Penobscot; Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 5:38AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast and East Central Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock and Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 AM EST, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The rain in combination with snowmelt had started to overwhelm storm drainage systems. Low-water crossings were becoming inundated with water and soon will be impassable. The runoff will reach small streams which will rise steadily through the day, with the potential to come out of their banks. Flood prone streams should be closely monitored. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Ellsworth, Bar Harbor, Bucksport, Dexter, Newport, Blue Hill, Cherryfield, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Corinth, Deer Isle, Veazie, Dedham, Castine, Kenduskeag and Steuben. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
